bitfield.description: Reads return 0s

Pending transfer: Set when control registers are written to by the CPU and there is already an active transfer in progress (ACTV = 1) and cleared when the transfer becomes active.PEND = 1: Transfer is pending PEND = 0: No pending transfer
Active transfer: Set when channel 0 begins reading data from the source address and cleared following the last write to the destination address.ACTV = 1: Active transfer ACTV = 0: No active transfer
Register Mask bit:M31 = 1: Register access blocked (masked)M31 = 0: Register access permitted (not masked)
Register Mask bit:M30 = 1: Register access blocked (masked)M30 = 0: Register access permitted (not masked)
Register Mask bit:M29 = 1: Register access blocked (masked)M29 = 0: Register access permitted (not masked)

Register Mask bit:M0 = 1: Register access blocked (masked)M0 = 0: Register access permitted (not masked)
Source Address: Must point to a 32-byte-aligned (e.g. window-aligned) memory location local to DSP megamodule or to a valid configuration register space.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Destination Address: Must point to a 32-byte-aligned (e.g. windowaligned) memory location local to DSP megamodule or to a valid configuration register space.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
CPU interrupt enable INT = 1: Interrupt CPU (IDMA_INT0) on completion INT = 0: Do not interrupt CPU on completion
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Window count COUNT = 0000: Transfer to/from one 32-word window COUNT = n: Transfer to/from n+1 32-word windows
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.

Pending transfer: Set when control registers are written to by the CPU and there is already an active transfer in progress (ACTV = 1) and cleared when the transfer becomes active.PEND = 1: Transfer is pendingPEND = 0: No pending transfer
Active transfer: Set when channel 1 begins reading data from the source address and cleared following the last write to the destination address.ACTV = 1: Active transferACTV = 0: No active transfer

Source Address: Must point to a word-aligned memory location local to GEM. When performing a block fill (IDMA1_COUNT.FILL = 1) the source address is the fill value. Note that when performing a Fill Mode transfer all 32-bits of the SOURCEADDR are writeable and when performing a linear transfer the two LSBs are implemented as 00b.
Destination Address: Must point to a word-aligned memory location local to DSP megamodule.
Reads return 0sWrite 0 for further compaibility
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.

register.description: ICFG Memory Protection Fault Address Register

bitfield.description: Fault Address

register.description: ICFG Memory Protection Fault Status Register

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Faulted ID:VBUS PrivID of faulting requestor. This field is valid only if LE is zero.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Access type

register.description: ICFG Memory Protection Fault Command Register

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Write 0: No effectWrite 1: Clear fault logged information
Error detected
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Transaction IDStores the Transaction ID when an error is detected on the response. Value should match the command id for the access that resulted in an error.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Transaction StatusStores the non-zero status/error code that wasdetected on the response to an access

bitenum.description: Success (should not cause error to be latched), or unrecognized RID/WID (should cause error to be latched)

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.

Clear ErrorCLR = 0: Writes of 0 have no effect.CLR = 1: Write of 1 clears all bits in the IBUSERRregister. Once an error is detected, the MDMA Error register must be cleared before additional errors canbe detected/stored.
Transfer priority. Used for arbitration between CPU and DMA accesses when there are conflicts.PRI = 111b: Low priorityPRI = 000b: High priority
CPU interrupt enableINT = 1: Interrupt CPU (IDMA_INT1) on completionINT = 0: Do not interrupt CPU on completion
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.

Block fill:FILL = 1: Perform a block fill using the Source address field as the fill value to the memory buffer pointed to by the Destination address field.FILL = 0: Block transfer from the source address to the destination address.
16-bit byte count. Must be a multiple of 4 bytes. A transfer count of zero will not transfer any data, but will generate an interrupt if requested in the INT field.
Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
